title: MonoliquidSystemDescription_TFCR

solvent_description.title: solvent_description
solvent_description.description: The solvent used in the reaction system, e.g. a buffered aqueous solution or an organic solvent.

ionic_strength.title: ionic_strength
ionic_strength.description: Ionic strength calculated according to the dissolved ions in the solvent. The following formula can be used: $$I = \frac{1}{2} \sum

ionic_strength_unit.title: ionic_strength_unit
ionic_strength_unit.description: The unit of ionic strength is usually expressed in mol/L (moles per liter), or in mmol/L (millimoles per liter). (

further_additives.title: further_additives
further_additives.description: Further additive like cosolvents used to increase solubility of reactants, e.g. DMSO.

Flow_rate.title: Flow_rate
Flow_rate.description: The flow rate must be specified to determine how fast a liquid or gas is flowing through a reactor or system.

Flow_rate_unit.title: Flow_rate_unit
Flow_rate_unit.description: Common units for describing flow rate include L/min (liters per minute), mL/h (milliliters per hour), mÂ³/h (cubic meters per hour), or other volume units per unit of time.

special_treatment.title: special_treatment
special_treatment.description: If there are any other specific methods, procedures, characteristics or aspects related to the monoliquid system that are important for reproducibility and are not described by the aforementioned           metadata, they should be explained here.

description: To describe a monoliquid system, precise information about the solvent used and the applied system must be provided.
